intro: Solidago graminifolia f. gemmans, commonly known as the gemmans goldenrod, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant is native to specific regions of North America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowering period typically occurs in late summer to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. The subspecies is noted for its compact growth habit and ornamental value in native plant gardens.
